page.shortlink: Open a Report, Label or Letter layout
page.topic: Open a Report, Label or Letter layout
page.description: Displays a report, label or letter layout as a PDF file using the Acrobat PDF reader. The report is displayed in either a pop-up window or in a DIV on the current page.

case.title: Report name
case.description: The name of the Report, Label, or Letter to open.

description.p: How to render the report. The report can be rendered as a PDF or HTML.

item.name: PDF
item.description: The report is rendered as a PDF.

item.name: HTML
item.description: The report is rendered as HTML. This option is *[not]* supported for Letters, Labels, or reports that were not created using the Layout Table editor.

item.name: HTML-Paged
item.description: The report is rendered as paged HTML. This option is only supported for Reports created using the Alpha Anywhere Report engine.

item.name: PDFDirect
item.description: Deprecated. Identical to *[ui:PDF]*. The report is rendered as a PDF.

description.p: The report is generated as a Microsoft Word document.
If this option is selected, the *[ui:target]* property must be set to either *[ui:Download]* or *[Xbasic]*.

important.p: *[How to report PDF reporting issues to Alpha Software]*

If your report does not render correctly when printed as a PDF, right click on the report in the Web Project Control Panel and select the Create Bug Report menu option under the Datasources menu. Select a location to store the .zip file and be sure to check the Include Raw Pages option. Send the zip file to [bugs@alphasoftware.com].

note.p: For best performance, *[ui:HTML]* is recommended for Layout Table reports.

description.p: An optional filter applied to the report. *[ui:Filter]* is defined using DBF syntax. The filter is in addition to any filter that was defined as part of the report layout.
This property is only shown if the report, letter, or label is based on a DBF table.
An optional order applied to the report. *[ui:Order]* is defined using DBF syntax. The order overrides the order defined in the report layout.
This property is only shown if the report, letter, or label is based on a DBF table.

An optional filter applied to the report. *[ui:SQL Filter]* is defined using SQL syntax. It is executed on the Database Server. (This filter is in addition to any filter that was defined as part of the report layout).
If the report is being created in a Grid component, you can use the function *[xb:currentGridFilter()]* to filter the Report using the Grid filter.
If the report is being created for a List control, you can use the function *[xb:currentListFilter("LIST_NAME")]* to filter the Report using the List's filter.
This property is only shown if the report, letter, or label is based on a SQL data source.
An optional order applied to the report. *[ui:SQL Order]* is defined using SQL syntax. The order overrides the order defined in the report layout.
You can use the function *[xb:currentGridOrder()]* to order the Report using the Grid order.
If the report is being created for a List control, you can use the function *[xb:currentListOrder("LIST_NAME")]* to order the Report using the List's order.
This property is only shown if the report, letter, or label is based on a SQL data source.
In addition to the *[ui:SQL Filter]*, you can define a local filter. The local filter is executed after the data is retrieved from the SQL database but before the report is generated.
The local is defined using Xbasic syntax. For example:
The local filter will have a performance impact on report generation. You should only use a local filter if it's not possible to define the filter as a SQL Filter.
The local order is applied after the data is retrieved from the SQL database. *[ui:Local Order]* is defined using Xbasic syntax. For example:
Available if the *[ui:Initial view]* is set to *[ui:PDF]*.
The following options are available for configuring a PDF:

item.name: Multilingual support
item.description: Adds support for international character sets.

item.name: Embed fonts
item.description: Include required fonts in the PDF instead of allowing them to be resolved externally.
item.note: If the font is protected, it can't be embedded; this is often the case for bar code fonts, such as Code39.

item.name: Linearize
item.description: If the PDF file will be displayed in a web application, linearization allows the browser to display pages from the PDF file before the entire PDF file has been downloaded. See also Linearize.

item.name: Black and white
item.description: Converts all colors to black, white, and gray.

item.name: Convert hyperlinks
item.description: Converts all hyperlinks started with "http://" into live links in the resulting PDF document.

item.name: JPEG Image Quality
item.description: Set the quality of JPEG images; this is a trade-off between image fidelity and size. Low quality uses the highest compression and produces the smallest images. No Compression produces the largest, highest-quality images.

item.name: Watermark
item.description: If enabled, prints a watermark on every page in the report. The properties below are also exposed.

item.name: Watermark type
item.description: Specifies how to create the watermark. The options are:

item.name: Text
item.description: Watermark is defined as text, including the font, color, orientation, and position.

item.name: PDF
item.description: Watermark is defined as a PDF. Use this option to display a logo or other image as a watermark.

item.name: Text
item.description: The text to use as a watermark. This property is only available if *[ui:Watermark Type]* is set to *[ui:Text]*

item.name: Font name
item.description: The font to use for the watermark text. This property is only available if *[ui:Watermark Type]* is set to *[ui:Text]*

item.name: Font size
item.description: The font size to use for the watermark text. This property is only available if *[ui:Watermark Type]* is set to *[ui:Text]*

item.name: Orientation
item.description: The rotation of the watermark text in 0.1 degree increments. This property is only available if *[ui:Watermark Type]* is set to *[ui:Text]*

item.name: Font color
item.description: The font color to use for the watermark text. This property is only available if *[ui:Watermark Type]* is set to *[ui:Text]*

item.name: Horizontal position
item.description: The horizontal position of the watermark text in 0.1 inch units. This positive value measured from the left edge of the page should take into account the minimum printer margin. This property is only available if *[ui:Watermark Type]* is set to *[ui:Text]*

item.name: Vertical position
item.description: The vertical position of the watermark text in 0.1 inch units. This negative value measured from the top of the page should take into account the minimum printer margin. This property is only available if *[ui:Watermark Type]* is set to *[ui:Text]*

item.name: Watermark file name
item.description: The name of a PDF file to use as the watermark. Optionally, click *[ui:Click to create PDF from Bitmap]* to display the Create PDF File from Bitmap dialog. This property is only available if *[ui:Watermark Type]* is set to *[ui:PDF]*

item.name: Foreground
item.description: When enabled, places the watermark above the page text, partially obscuring page content. When disabled, places the watermark below the page text.

item.name: Encrypt PDF file
item.description: Check this property if you want to require a password to open the PDF file or set file permissions for the PDF. If enabled, the properties below are also exposed.

item.name: Owner password
item.description: Specifies the text to use as the owner password. Only the owner can change the User password and the document other settings.

item.name: User password
item.description: Specifies the text to use as the read password.

item.name: Can print
item.description: Specifies whether the reader can print the document.

item.name: Can modify document
item.description: Specifies whether the reader can edit the document.

item.name: Can copy
item.description: Specifies whether the reader can select text in the document and copy it.

item.name: Can add notes
item.description: Specifies whether the reader can add notes.

item.name: Use 128 bit key
item.description: Selects between 40 bit and 128 bit encryption. Readers will need Adobe Acrobat version 5 or higher to read 128 bit encrypted files.

item.name: PDF Title
item.description: The title of the PDF. This title is shown in some browser PDF viewers.

description.p: Optional local arguments. These arguments can be used in the SQL Filter or SQL Order for the report.

If the report includes arguments, the arguments are set in *[ui:Argument bindings]*. Arguments can be bound to a constant value (e.g. *[xb:Smith]*), a field in the component (e.g. *[xb:{customer_id}]*), a session variables (e.g. *[xb:context.session.clientID]*), or computed by calling a JavaScript function (e.g. *[xb:(Javascript:myFunctionName)]* where *[em:myFunctionName]* is the name of the JavaScript function.)

case.title: PDF open parameters
case.description: Specify parameter to control how the PDF is displayed when it is initially rendered. You can set properties such as the zoom level. Not all PDF readers support these properties.

case.title: Has window close button
case.description: If checked, displays a close button on the window toolbar for the HTML report. It is recommended to add a close button if the Window title bar has been turned off.

case.title: Close button text
case.description: The text shown in the close button. This property is only available if *[ui:Has window close button]* has been checked.

case.title: Print as PDF
case.description: Show a button on the HTML Report viewer to make a callback and render the report as a PDF document.

case.title: Export to Excel
case.description: Show a button to export the Report to Excel

case.title: Export to Word
case.description: Show a button to export the Report to Word

case.title: Export to Text
case.description: Show a button to export the Report to text file

case.title: Print
case.description: Show a button to print the HTML report.

case.title: Report Bookmarks button type
case.description: If the report you are viewing has bookmarks, the bookmarks are shown in a Panel. If the report container is too narrow to show the Bookmarks Panel, the Panel is automatically collapsed, and a button is shown to display the Bookmarks Panel. Specify the button style. Choices include *[ui:Text]*, *[ui:Image]*.

case.title: Report Bookmarks button text
case.description: Specify the text for the Bookmarks button.

case.title: Report Bookmarks button image
case.description: Specify the text for the Bookmarks button.

case.title: Report Bookmarks panel width
case.description: Specify the width for the Bookmarks Panel. Use CSS syntax (not %). If there is insufficient space to show the Panel, it will be automatically collapsed and can then be shown by clicking on the Bookmarks button.

case.title: Maximum records to display
case.description: Specify the maximum number of records to display in the HTML report. Enter 0 to see all records. Limiting the number of records will allow the report to display faster.

case.title: 'More records' message
case.description: Specify the message to show if there are more records in the report than the number in the display limit. The message will not show if the total records in the report is less that the number set in the display limit. [DisplayRecords] is a placeholder for the number of records to display. [TotalRecords] is a placeholder for the total number of records in the report.

case.title: 'More records' message container style
case.description: Specify the in-line style for the container that holds the 'More records' message.

section.title: Target Window, DIV, Tabbed UI Pane or Panel

case.title: Target
case.description:
Defines what happens to the report after it is generated. Options include:
Target Option Description
Window Report will be opened in a modeless or modal popup window after it is generated. Not supported for *[ui:DocX]*.
DIV Report will be opened in a DIV on the page. Not supported for *[ui:DocX]*.
TabbedUIPane Report will be opened in a new pane in a Tabbed UI. If the component is not running inside a Tabbed UI, the report will be opened in a modeless popup window. Not supported for *[ui:DocX]*.
Download Report will be downloaded to the client.
Xbasic Report will be sent to an Xbasic function, defined in the *[ui:Xbasic function]* property.
Panel Report will be opened in an existing Panel Card. Not supported for *[ui:DocX]*.
DynamicPanel Report will be opened in a new dynamic Panel Card inside a Panel Navigator. Not supported for *[ui:DocX]*.

case.title: Target Panel
case.description: The id of an existing Panel Card where the report will be shown.

case.title: Target DIV ID
case.description: Specify the ID of the target DIV. This DIV can be in the Grid component (for example, in a free-form edit region), or on the .a5w page that contains the Grid component.

tip.p: If you want to specify a DIV that is inside a freeform edit region in a Grid cell, use the *[js:{grid.rowID}]* placeholder in the DIV id. For example:
This will ensure that each row has a uniquely named DIV in which the target page can be displayed.

case.title: Parent Panel Navigator
case.description: Specify the Id of the parent Panel Navigator. The dynamic Panel will be added to this Panel Navigator.

description.p: The title for the dynamic panel added to a Panel Navigator where the report will be displayed. The panel title can be dynamically generated at runtime using JavaScript. To call a JavaScript function to generate the panel title, set the *[ui:Dynamic Panel Title]* property to the following:
Where *[em:myFunction]* is the name of your JavaScript function. The JavaScript function must return a string.

case.title: User can close dynamic panel
case.description: (Only applies if the target Panel Navigator has been configured to use a Tab Band) Specify if the label for the dynamically added Panel has a 'close' icon that allows the user to close the dynamically added Panel.

case.title: Working message placement
case.description: Specify the panel where the wait message should be shown. You should chose a Panel that is currently visible, not a Panel that will be animated into view when the component is rendered.

case.title: Working message uses CSS3 animation?
case.description: Specify if the working message should be displayed using a CSS3 animation?

case.title: Working message animation size
case.description: Specify the size of the animation in pixels.

case.title: Can hide target DIV?
case.description: Specify the DIV can be hidden (to remove from view the target page after it has been opened in the DIV).

case.title: DIV hide hyperlink
case.description: Specify text for the hyperlink that hides the DIV where the target page is shown.

case.title: Target IFrame style
case.description: The target page will be opened in an IFrame inside the target DIV. Specify the inline style for the IFrame. You can set the IFrame's height and width in the style.

case.title: Report height
case.description: Specify the height of the report. The report container DIV will be resized to this height. Use CSS units.

case.title: Report width
case.description: Specify the width of the report. The report container DIV will be resized to this height. Use CSS units.

case.title: Window name
case.description: Set to <Default> to give the window a default name. If you give the window an explicit name (which must be unique), then you can easily get a pointer to the window to execute methods of the window object. Click the smart field for tips on how to name your window and for information on how to get a pointer to the window object.

case.title: Window type
case.description: Specify the window type. Popup windows will show in a moveable window on the page. Dropdown windows have no title bar and cannot be moved. By default, Dropdown windows open directly below the control that you click to open the window.

note.p: An Ajax window will NOT be blocked by a browser's internal protection against popup windows.

description.p: Specify the CSS class name to use for the overlay that is displayed behind the window. The overlay prevents the user from clicking on controls that are outside the window. Leave blank, or specify <Default> to use the default style. Specify <Invisible> to create an invisible overlay (has no color, but user is still prevented from clicking on controls off the window). By specifying a class that has a 'background' attribute, you can control the color of the overlay. For example:
to create a transparent overlay.

case.title: Sub-theme
case.description: An optional sub-theme for the window. The sub-theme can select a different pre-defined window 'look'. If you leave this property blank, the 'base' sub-theme is used.

case.title: Dock window
case.description: Docked windows 'stick' to an edge of the screen and remain in place even when the page is scrolled.

case.title: Dock location
case.description: Specify which edge of the screen the window is docked to. Choices include *[ui:Left]*, *[ui:Right]*, *[ui:Top]*, *[ui:Bottom]*.

case.title: Window position
case.description: Specify where the window will be shown.

case.title: Re-use existing window
case.description: Specify if multiple modeless windows can be opened, or only a single modeless window.

case.title: Window title
case.description: Specify the window title. The window title can contain data from fields in the current record. Enclose field values in curly braces. E.g. Customer - {lastname}. To reference values from a column in a List control use this syntax: {LIST::ListName::ColumnName} (e.g. {LIST::MYLIST1::LASTNAME} )

case.title: Window title show
case.description: Specify if the window title should be shown or hidden.

case.title: Window title position
case.description: Specify if the window title should appear at the top or bottom of the window. Choices include *[ui:Top]*, *[ui:Bottom]*.

case.title: Window title direction
case.description: Specify if the direction is 'ltr' (left-to-right) (title on left, close button on right) or 'rtl' (right-to-left) (close button on left and title on right). Choices include *[ui:ltr]*, *[ui:rtl]*.

case.title: Window title has close button
case.description: Specify if the window title has a Close button.

case.title: Disable window move
case.description: Specify if the window cannot be moved by the user.

case.title: Pane title
case.description: Specify the tab pane title. The pane title can contain data from fields in the current record. Enclose field values in curly braces. E.g. Customer - {lastname}. To reference values from a column in a List control use this syntax: {LIST::ListName::ColumnName} (e.g. {LIST::MYLIST1::LASTNAME} )

case.title: Window height
case.description: Specify the window height. Use CSS syntax. For example: 3in, 10cm, 200px. If you do not set the height, the window will resize automatically to accommodate the window contents.

case.title: Window width
case.description: Specify the window height. Use CSS syntax. For example: 3in, 10cm, 200px. If you do not set the width, the window will resize automatically to accommodate the window contents.

case.title: Window is resizable
case.description: If checked, the user can resize the window.

case.title: Working message
case.description: Specify the text of the message to show in the window while the window waits for its contents to be generated. You can use this placeholder in the message: {reportName}

case.title: Working message icon
case.description: Specify the image to show in the window while the window waits for its contents to be generated.

case.title: Client-side file name
case.description: Specify the default filename on the user's computer (when they download the file). If you leave this blank, the filename of the server will be used as the default client-side filename.

case.title: Xbasic function
case.description: Specify the name of the Xbasic function to call after the report has been created.

case.title: DIV Id for progress messages
case.description: Specify the ID of a DIV where the 'working...' message, and any error messages, should be shown. This DIV can be in the Grid component (for example, in a free-form edit region), or on the .a5w page that contains the Grid component. TIP: If you want to specify a DIV that is inside a freeform edit region in a Grid cell, use the '{grid.rowID}' placeholder in the DIV id. For example: 'div1_Row{grid.rowID}'. This will ensure that each row has a uniquely named DIV in which the messages can be displayed.

case.title: Has pointer icon
case.description: Specify if the window has a pointer icon that points to the element that was clicked to show the window.

case.title: Pointer position
case.description: Specify the window edge that has the pointer icon. If you select 'Auto' the most appropriate edge is automatically selected. Choices include *[ui:Auto]*, *[ui:Top]*, *[ui:Bottom]*, *[ui:Left]*, *[ui:Right]*.

case.title: Has custom toolbar buttons
case.description: Specify if the window has custom buttons in the window toolbar (at the bottom of the window).

case.title: Define buttons
case.description: Define the buttons that appear in the window toolbar (at the bottom of the window).

case.title: Buttons in-line style
case.description: In-line style for the buttons. TIP: To display the buttons left justified, enter an in-line style of: text-align:left;

case.title: Show top bar
case.description: Specify if a top bar should be shown. (Displayed above the window body inside the body container).

case.title: Top bar HTML
case.description: Specify the HTML to show in the top bar.

case.title: Top bar style
case.description: Specify the in-line style for the top bar.

case.title: Show bottom bar
case.description: Specify if a top bar should be shown. (Displayed below the body inside the body container).

case.title: Bottom bar HTML
case.description: Specify the HTML to show in the top bar.

case.title: Bottom bar style
case.description: Specify the in-line style for the top bar.

case.title: Show header
case.description: Specify if a header should be shown. (Displayed above the window body inside the body container).

case.title: Header HTML
case.description: Specify the HTML to show in the header.

case.title: Header style
case.description: Specify the in-line style for the top bar.

case.title: Show footer
case.description: Specify if a footer should be shown. (Displayed below the body, the bottom bar, and below any user-defined buttons).

case.title: Footer HTML
case.description: Specify the HTML to show in the footer.

case.title: Footer style
case.description: Specify the in-line style for the footer.

case.title: Before execute event
case.description: Specify the name of a Javascript function to call before the callback is made to open the target Report. This Javascript function will take 'ro' as an input parameter. 'ro' contains all of the settings for the target Report to be opened. The purpose of this function is to allow you to override any of the properties of the passed-in 'ro' object.

case.title: After execute Javascript
case.description: Specify the Javascript code to run after the Report has been printed.

case.title: Animation
case.description: Specify if the window should be animated when it is shown or hidden.

note.p: If the window contains an iframe that contains a PDF viewer, animation should not be used.

case.title: Show animation style
case.description: Select the animation method to use when the window is shown. Fade and Slide use methods in jQuery core. Other options require jQueryUI.

case.title: Show animation speed
case.description: Specify the animation speed. You can select a pre-defined option (slow = 600 milliseconds, fast = 200 milliseconds), or you can enter an explicit value in milliseconds.

case.title: Hide animation style
case.description: Select the animation method to use when the window is closed. Fade and Slide use methods in jQuery core. Other options require jQueryUI.

case.title: Hide animation speed
case.description: Specify the animation speed. You can select a pre-defined option (slow = 600 milliseconds, fast = 200 milliseconds), or you can enter an explicit value in milliseconds.

case.title: onInitialize
case.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute the first time the window is shown.

case.title: onBeforeShow
case.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute before the window is shown.

case.title: onShow
case.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute when the window is shown.

case.title: onBeforeHide
case.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute before the window is hidden.

case.title: onHide
case.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute when the window is hidden.

case.title: onFocus
case.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute when the window gets focus.

case.title: onMove
case.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute when the window is moved.

case.title: onResize
case.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute when the window is resized.

case.title: Offline Javascript
case.description: JavaScript to execute if the device is offline. Since the device is offline, the Ajax callback is not made. Therefore the code in the 'Ajax failed Javascript' property will not get executed.

videos.title: Action Javascript - Binding an Argument Value to Result of a Javascript Function

description.p: This video is aimed at advanced developers.

When you use Action Javascript to open a Grid, Report, Dialog, Custom Component, etc., you often need to bind the value of an argument to a value from the parent Component. For example, you might bind the value of "arg1" to the value of the Lastname field in the current grid row.

Instead of binding an argument to the value of a field in the Grid, you can specify an arbitrary JavaScript function to execute. The argument is bound to the value returned by the JavaScript function.

videos.title: Printing the Currently Selected Records or Opening a Grid Showing Currently Selected Records

description.p: Putting a button on a Grid to open another Grid or a Report is easily accomplished using Action Javascript. This video shows how you can use the special Alpha Anywhere functions CurrentGridFilter() and CurrentGridOrder() to print the records that are currently selected in the Grid. You can also use these functions to open another Grid showing the same selection of records in the current Grid.

When you add a Report to a Tabbed UI, or you display a report when a button is clicked, you now have the option of setting the "initial view" of the report to HTML. A benefit of HTML reporting is the ability to export the report to Excel or Word. You can also generate a PDF report from an HTML report if you still want a PDF version of the report.
In this video, we show how HTML reporting can be used in a Tabbed UI, and when a button in a Grid is clicked to show a report.

note.p: This video also applies to the Grid and UX Component

videos.title: Using the IN Clause in the Report Filter - Understanding 'Array Arguments'

description.p: When you use Action Javascript to display a report, you specify the report filter. In the case of reports that are based on SQL data sources, you can now use the SQL IN clause in your filter expression. When you use the IN clause, the argument you pass the SQL statement must be defined as an "array argument".
In this video, we show how to configure the Action Javascript to display a report filtered using an IN clause and how to create an array argument.
This video applies to the Grid and UX Component.

note.p: The sample component requires a connection string called "Northwind" to sample Northwind database.

description.p: When you add a Report to a Tabbed UI, or you display a report when a button is clicked, you now have the option of setting the "initial view" of the report to HTML. A significant benefit of HTML reporting is the ability to export the report to Excel or Word. You can also generate a PDF report from an HTML report if you still want a PDF version of the report.
In this video, we show how HTML reporting can be used in a Tabbed UI, and when a button in a Grid is clicked to show a report.

note.p: This video also applies to the Grid and UX Component

videos.title: Using HTML Reporting in a Mobile Application

description.p: HTML Reporting is ideal for Mobile Applications because the HTML report can easily be displayed in one of the "Panels" in a UX component.

In this video, we show how a UX component with a Panel Navigator is built. The Panel Navigator has two Panel Cards. The first Panel Card has buttons to print various reports. The second Panel Card is used to display the HTML report.

When you design reports, you can turn on the 'bookmarks' and 'table of contents' features. The 'bookmark' feature creates a tree control of all of the 'bookmarks' in the report and allows you to navigate to any section of the report by clicking on a appropriate item in the 'bookmark tree', which is displayed to the left of the report itself. The 'table of contents' section, on the other hand, is shown before the first page of the report. You can also navigate to any particular section of the report by clicking on an entry in the table of contents.

In HTML reports, the 'bookmarks' tree is automatically rendered in a Panel as is shown in this video. In a mobile application, the Panel Card that contains the bookmark tree is automatically hidden if there is not enough space on the device. In the case where it is hidden, a button is automatically added to the Panel Header to reveal the bookmarks.

note.p: This video applies to the Grid and UX Component.

videos.title: Printing a Report Using Same Filter/Order as a List Control

description.p: A common pattern in Grids is to have a button on a Grid that prints a report showing the same records that are in the current Grid query. You can use a similar pattern for List controls on a UX component.

In this video, we show a UX with a List control. The List control is based on a SQL query and the UX has a button that allows you to perform a server-side filter on the List (for example, search for all records in France or Denmark).
The UX has a button that prints a report that is based on the same SQL tables as the List and automatically uses the same filter for the report as the List.
When you render reports in a Web application you can choose whether the report should be rendered as PDF or HTML. The HTML option is only available for Layout Table reports - not Freeform reports.

The HTML-Paged option will work with all report types -- Freeform and Layout Table and can be rendered in any browser (including mobile device browsers that do not have the ability to render PDF files.
This video compares the different report output options.

videos.title: Using SQL Server Reporting Services Reports in an Alpha Anywhere Project

description.p: Many organizations who use SQL Server also use SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS). Using reports created in SSRS in an Alpha Anywhere project is possible.
In this video, we show how reports defined in SSRS can be used in Alpha Anywhere applications.
